subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Clemson running back Ray Ray McElrathbey, who gained national attention two years ago for taking custody of his 11-year-old brother, will not play for the Tigers in the fall.Clemson Coach Tommy Bowden said in a news release that McElrathbey, 21, would graduate in August. McElrathbey has two years of eligibility left and could play for another program or remain at Clemson to pursue a master’s degree.McElrathbey missed all of last season after knee surgery in September to repair a torn anterior cruciate ligament. He has not said what he plans to do.
